group_1.textCenter: No... What's this I'm seeing?
I'm falling...
It's like I'm falling, deeper and deeper,@inside of my own brain...

group_1.narration: My dearest reader, I beg you lay rest all@that you think you know about the universe.
Do you pursue knowledge as I do? Then please@look again at the world through a child's eyes.
There are countless factors behind the@progress of humanity, and learning, which is but@one such factor, is the result of many others.
Common sense is not applicable to progress.@As such, what is required of us to move forward@are countless perspectives and open minds.
If you are to read this text, which I have titled@"Magical Girls: Their Hope and Despair",@you must possess the above qualities.
This book is a record of the following@realities: Girls protect this world.@Our civilization exists thanks to them.@The culture that surrounds them persists to this day.
I assure you, I have not been driven mad by@my research. Nor is this a work of fiction.@This book is the result of research,@observation, and repeated fieldwork.
And so, dear reader... Judge this work only@once you have peered across the contents of@every page and observed their battles, their@wishes, and the role they play fully for yourself.
Reclaim the innocent perspective@of a child, just this once.
I, myself, understand your cynicism@as well as anyone, as one thrust@into the world of folklore.
My first meeting with a Magical Girl@was not in the corporeal world, but bound@in the pages of my uncle's memoirs.

group_1.textCenter: Phew! My medical exam with Dad is all done!
*Giggle*
(Now I can finally do what I've been waiting@so long to do!)
(If Papa caught me with my uncle's book,@he'd probably get really mad.)

group_1.narration: Magical Girls: Their Hope and Despair (I)

group_1.textCenter: (Magical Girls...)
(Perhaps they have something to do with my@uncle's disappearance...)
Hmm...
It's only normal to get curious about stuff@people tell you you're not allowed to read.
I want to learn more about this weird@Kyubey creature he wrote about...
(In the book it was described as being like@a dog, or maybe a weasel...)
(But it has such a fancy name. It almost@sounds like a samurai...)
(Maybe its name is code for something?)
(Kyubey... Cube-A?)
(A is the first letter of the alphabet...)
(Alpha... That can mean "commander". A cube@of commanders?)
Nope... I don't understand it one bit.
I guess it's time to make use of my super@special Touka-deluxe machines!
I'm sure the Internet has some info about@this. Let's have a look...

group_1.textRight: They're running some final tests, so it'll be@another two weeks or so, but yeah.

group_1.textCenter: This is outrageously unprecedented...@It may end up causing a huge media frenzy.
Not long ago your condition was so severe!

group_1.textRight: But they did all kinds of thorough@examinations...
And they didn't find anything wrong with me@at all.

group_1.textCenter: They say fate moves in mysterious ways, @and it seems true miracles do happen.
That said...I'm really happy for you.
Touka...

group_1.textLeft: No, I'm the one who's sorry.
I'm happy for you, I really I am, just... I'm@gonna miss you so much.
But compared to when you lost consciousness,@and all your brain activity almost ceased...
It's much, much better to have you still@alive.
I remember thinking I wouldn't mind becoming@a Magical Girl to help you, back then...

group_1.textCenter: Did Touka just say something extremely@fanciful and fictional? That's not like her.
I thought I might die of shock for a moment.

group_1.textLeft: Shut up! Forget I said anything! Whatever!
It's not like I learned anything when I @looked into it, so who cares!
Make sure to come visit us with your sister@when you get a chance.

group_1.textRight: Yes! I'll be coming in for tests and things,@so I should have lots of chances to visit.
Oh! And I won't go to any of the places on@the map we made together.
I'm waiting until we can go as a group!

group_1.textCenter: Okay.
What... What is this place?
Uiii! Nemuuu!
We're all safe for now, it seems...

group_1.textLeft: We all went to sleep in the same hospital@room, didn't we?

group_1.textCenter: Yes. That should be the case.

group_1.textLeft: Then where are we now? I'm...scared...

group_1.textCenter: I haven't the faintest idea either.
Honestly, what comes to mind is that we're@in the midst of an evil spirits' march.

group_1.textRight: Do you guys see something over there, too?

group_1.textCenter: *Whirrrrrr* *Clicky Click*
Touka!
[flashEffect:flashRed2][se:4001_equip_arms_bow_vh][bgEffect:shakeLarge][name:sprite_0:effect_shake]*Click Click* *Whirrr* *Whwhwhirr*
It was her.

group_1.textRight: The Witch is this way, Iroha!

group_1.textLeft: Kyubey! Wait up! My sister and her friends@are over here!

group_1.textCenter: Iroha?! Is it really you?
